channel.title: Shiny on Columbia DSI Scholars
channel.description: Recent content in Shiny on Columbia DSI Scholars

item.title: Data For Good: African North Americans Database
item.description: This project is the first comprehensive examination of African North Americans who crossed one of the U.S.-Canada borders, going either direction, after the Underground Railroad, in the generation alive roughly 1865-1930. It analyzes census and other records to match individuals and families across the decades, despite changes or ambiguities in their names, ages, “color,” birthplace, or other details.

item.title: Project: Enhancing self-directed learning opportunities
item.description: Analyze data from one of the following library applications/systems and create visualizations that highlight the most important findings pertaining to the support of self-directed learning: Vialogues (TC Video Discussion Application), PocketKnowledge (TC Online Archive), DocDel (E-Reserve System), Pressible (Blogging Platform), Library Website and Mobile App.
